layer.description: The data is posted to Ethereum as calldata.

bridge.description: The validating bridge has access to all the data, as it is posted onchain.

badges.name: Application-specific chain
badges.description: This project is built to operate a specific application

badges.name: Ethereum with calldata
badges.description: This project is posting its data to Ethereum as calldata

badges.name: Fork of ZKsync Lite
badges.description: The project is fork of ZKsync Lite

display.name: Term Structure
display.description: Term Structure introduces a distinct ZK Rollup solution democratizing fixed-rate and fixed-term borrowing and lending as well as fixed income trading by offering low transaction fees and enabling forced withdrawals.

liveness.explanation: Term Structure is a ZK rollup based on ZKsync Lite's code base that posts state diffs to the L1. For a transaction to be considered final, the state diffs have to be submitted and a validity proof should be generated, submitted, and verified.

stateValidation.description: SNARKs are succinct zero knowledge proofs that ensure state correctness, but require trusted setup.

dataAvailability.description: All of the data needed for proof construction is published on Ethereum L1.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: Users can force the sequencer to include a transaction by submitting a request through L1. If the sequencer censors or is down for  for more than 14d, users can use the exit hatch to withdraw their funds.

proposerFailure.description: Users are able to trustlessly exit by submitting a zero knowledge proof of funds.

requirements: Upgrades executed by actors with more centralized control than a Security Council provide less than 7d for users to exit if the permissioned operator is down or censoring.
missing.principle: Compromising ≥75% of the Security Council should be the only way (other than bugs) for a rollup to indefinitely block an L2→L1 message (e.g. a withdrawal) or push an invalid L2→L1 message (e.g. an invalid withdrawal) wiith a <7d exit window.

requirements.description: A complete and functional proof system is deployed.
The project calls itself a rollup.
State roots are posted to Ethereum L1.
Inputs for the state transition function are posted to Ethereum L1.
A source-available node exists that can recreate the state from Ethereum L1 data. Please note that the L2BEAT team has not verified the validity of the node source code.
Users are able to exit without the help of the permissioned operators.
Upgrades executed by actors with more centralized control than a Security Council provide less than 7d for users to exit if the permissioned operator is down or censoring.

principle.description: Compromising ≥75% of the Security Council should be the only way (other than bugs) for a rollup to indefinitely block an L2→L1 message (e.g. a withdrawal) or push an invalid L2→L1 message (e.g. an invalid withdrawal) wiith a <7d exit window.

requirements.description: Upgrades unrelated to onchain provable bugs provide less than 30d to exit.

message.text: The requirement for available node software is under review

additionalConsiderations.short: Term Structure provides the infrastructure for fixed-rate leverage, lending and borrowing. Arbitrary contracts are not supported.
additionalConsiderations.long: Term Structure provides the infrastructure for fixed-rate leverage, lending and borrowing. Arbitrary contracts are not supported.

categories.title: Validity proofs
categories.description: Each update to the system state must be accompanied by a ZK proof that ensures that the new state was derived by correctly applying a series of valid user transactions to the previous state. These proofs are then verified on Ethereum by a smart contract.

references.title: RollupFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, verifyOneBlock function

dataAvailability.name: All data required for proofs is published onchain
dataAvailability.description: All the data that is used to construct the system state is published onchain in the form of cheap calldata. This ensures that it will always be available when needed.

operator.name: The system has a centralized operator
operator.description: The operator is the only entity that can propose blocks. A live and trustworthy operator is vital to the health of the system.

risks.text: the operator exploits their centralized position and frontruns user transactions.

references.title: RollupFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, onlyRole in commit, verify, execute functions

forceTransactions.name: Users can force exit the system
forceTransactions.description: Force exit allows the users to escape censorship by withdrawing their funds. The system allows users to force the withdrawal of funds by submitting a request directly to the contract onchain.  The request must be served within a defined time period. If this does not happen, the system will halt regular operation and permit trustless withdrawal of funds.

risks.text: the operator refuses to include their transactions. However, there exists a mechanism to independently exit the system.

references.title: AccountFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, forceWithdraw function
Force Withdrawal and Evacuation Mode - Term Structure documentation

exitMechanisms.name: Regular exit
exitMechanisms.description: The user initiates the withdrawal by submitting a regular transaction on this chain. When the block containing that transaction is settled the funds become available for withdrawal on L1. ZK proofs are required to settle blocks. Finally the user submits an L1 transaction to claim the funds.

references.title: AccountFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, withdraw function

exitMechanisms.name: Forced exit
exitMechanisms.description: If the user experiences censorship from the operator with regular exit they can submit their withdrawal requests directly on L1. The system is then obliged to service this request. Once the force operation is submitted and if the request is serviced, the operation follows the flow of a regular exit.

references.title: AccountFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, forceWithdraw function

exitMechanisms.name: Emergency exit
exitMechanisms.description: If the enough time deadline passes and the forced exit is still ignored the user can put the system into Evacuation Mode, disallowing further state updates. In that case everybody can withdraw by submitting a zero knowledge proof of their funds with their L1 transaction.

risks.text: the user is unable to generate the non-trivial ZK proof for exodus withdraw.

otherConsiderations.name: Flashloans on escrowed funds
otherConsiderations.description: The protocol allows flashloans with the funds locked with the bridge, for a fee.

references.title: FlashloanFacet.sol - Etherscan source code, flashLoan function

risks.text: the flashloan mechanism is implemented incorrectly.

actors.name: Admins
actors.description: Can update the main verifier, the evacuation verifier, can set the flash loan premium, set the half liquidation threshold, the liquidation factor, the borrow rate, the rollover fee, the withdraw protocol fee, the price feed, the stablecoin used, the minimum deposit amount and it can pause the system.

actors.name: TermStructure Multisig 1
actors.description:
A Multisig with 4/6 threshold. 
Owner of the protocol, meaning it can upgrade the project implementation potentially gaining access to all funds.

actors.name: Operators
actors.description: Can add tokens to the system.

actors.name: Committers
actors.description: Can commit blocks on L1 and revert pending (i.e. not yet executed) blocks.

actors.name: TermStructure Multisig 2
actors.description:
A Multisig with 4/6 threshold. 
Address collecting a portion of protocol fees. Currently set to 100% of the fees.

actors.name: TermStructure Multisig 3
actors.description:
A Multisig with 4/6 threshold. 
Address collecting a portion of protocol fees. Currently set to 0% of the fees.

actors.name: TermStructure Multisig 4
actors.description:
A Multisig with 4/6 threshold. 
Address collecting a portion of protocol fees. Currently set to 0% of the fees.

ethereum.name: ZkTrueUp
ethereum.description: Main contract of the system. It manages deposits, withdrawals, verification, permissions and DeFi operations.

ethereum.name: Verifier
ethereum.description: Verifier contract used to verify the SNARK proofs.

risks.text: a contract receives a malicious code upgrade. There is no delay on code upgrades.
